properties.areaDesc: Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island; Southeast Coastal Plains
properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 13 at 1:31PM AST until February 13 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS OCCURRING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO...

The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag
Warning, which is in effect until 6 PM AST this evening.

* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 014 and 027.

* WIND...15 to 20 mph with gusts to around 30 mph.

* HUMIDITY...30-40 percent across the southeast, while 40-50
percent across the southwest.

* THUNDERSTORMS...None.

* HIGHEST THREAT...Southeast coastal plains of Puerto Rico in the
vicinity of Camp Santiago, Salinas.

* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 014 AND 027
